info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 9:58AM CDT until August 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
Overnight rainfall caused some minor flooding and some roads may have debris on them this morning. Additional rain this morning will make some of the clean up challenging. If driving around this morning, expect to encounter some minor flooding or shallow water on roads.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Wisconsin, including the following counties, in southwest Wisconsin, Vernon. In west central Wisconsin, Monroe.
* WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell overnight and another one-half inch is expected this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cashton, Glendale, Leon, Portland, Norwalk, Ontario, Wilton, Kendall, Melvina, Oil City, St Marys, Tunnel Trail Campground, Hoffman Corners, Mount Tabor, Trippville and Highway 33 And County Y. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
